cab.content: 0149/6320.War Cabinet.. Supplies for General Denikin1s Force. Memorandum by the Secretary of State for War*In view of the discussions which have taken place in Paris, I propose to allow the supplies and stores, including the 100 aeroplanes (of which we have an enormous surplus in this country) to proceed as arranged to General Denikin's array, unless the War Cabinet desire that the matter should be again brought before them.Attention is drawn to the important success recently gained by General Deniki^s Army which makes &t urgent to give him the supplies he has been led to expect,21st February, 1919.Winston S. Churchill.
